problem.p: The two blocks shown here are in contact on a frictionless surface. Suppose that someone comes along and begins pushing on the left side of block 1, causing both blocks to begin to slide to the right. Assuming you will study the system composed of both blocks treated as a single point particle, determine which of the following interactions are internal to the system and which are external.

conceptgroup.choice: The gravitational interaction between the earth and block 1.
The contact interaction between the frictionless surface and block 1.
The gravitational interaction between the earth and block 2.
The contact interaction between the frictionless surface and block 2.

li.p: The contact interaction between block 1 and block 2.

optioninput.name: bl1bl2
optioninput.options: ('internal','external','not relevant to this system','not a valid interaction')

li.p: The contact interaction between the person pushing the blocks and block 1.

optioninput.name: person1
optioninput.options: ('internal','external','not relevant to this system','not a valid interaction')

li.p: The contact interaction between the person pushing the blocks and block 2.
